column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of LaO1−xFxFeAs (0 ≤ x ≤ 0.2) were prepared from pure components using a two-step solid state reaction method, similar to that described by Zhu et al. [29].

#Text=In the first step, Fe powder (Alfa Aesar, Puratronic, 99.998%) and powdered As lump (Alfa Aesar, 99.999%) were milled, mixed and pressed into pellets and annealed at 500◦C for 2 h and at 700◦C for 10 h in an evacuated silica tube.

#Text=In the second step, the FeAs pellets were milled and mixed with lanthanum powder (Goodfellow, 99.9%, 60 mesh), annealed La2O3 powder (Chempur, 99.99%), and anhydrous LaF3 powder (Alfa Aesar, 99.99%) and pressed into pellets under a pressure of 1 GPa.
#Text=All preparation steps were carried out under argon atmosphere.
#Text=The samples were then heated in an evacuated silica tube at 940◦C for 8 h and at 1150◦C for 40 h.
#Text=Due to the formation of a liquid phase at 1007◦C, determined by DTA/TG analysis, the 940◦C annealing step was extended compared to Zhu et al. [29] in order to improve the homogeneity.
